intro: Echinacea pallida, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the central and eastern regions of North America. It is characterized by its upright stem, lance-shaped leaves, and a striking pink to purple flower head that consists of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Echinacea pallida thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for native gardens. Its blooming period typically occurs from late summer into early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
